text: In Greek mythology, Anchiroe (Ancient Greek: Αγχιροη Ankhiroê means "pouring flow") may refer to the following figures: * Anchiroe, an Arcadian nymph and nurse of the god Zeus.Pausanias, Graeciae Descriptio 8.31.4 * Anchiroe, Argive daughter of the river god Erasinus. She is known for having received Britomartis.Antoninus Liberalis, Metamorphoses 40 * Anchiroe, daughter of the river god Chremetes, wife of Psyllus, the man who made war against Notus, and mother by him of Crataigonos, a Libyan who joined Dionysusin his Indian campaign.Nonnus, Dionysiaca 13.380 *Anchiroe or Achiroe, daughter of Nilus and wife of Belus.Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 2.1.4 *Anchiroe, consort of Sithon.Tzetzes on Lycophron 583 and 1161. == Notes == == References == * Antoninus Liberalis, The Metamorphoses of Antoninus Liberalis translated by Francis Celoria (Routledge 1992).
